description: Weekly individual tests from week 3-10 involving programming exercises and multiple choice questions under self-enforced exam conditions. Best 6 of 8 tests counted.
Weekly individual laboratory classes with practical problems involving course tools. Exercises submitted for automarking with tutor feedback on approach/style. Includes optional challenge exercises.
Two individual programming assignments: Assignment 1 focuses on shell programming (15%), Assignment 2 on Python programming (15%). Automarked with style/structure feedback.
Three-hour closed-book in-person exam with short-answer questions and implementation tasks. Includes hurdle requirement (minimum 40% to pass course). Conducted in CSE labs during exam period.
